title: Ticket #6382: Python bindings parse old ClassAds with new ClassAds escaping rules
description:
The python bindings understand both old and new ClassAds syntax. But when parsing old ClassAds format, they use the string escaping rules from new ClassAds. This causes string literals that contain a backslash to be parsed wrong, and some valid string values to result in a parse error.

In the python bindings, the OldClassAdIterator class passes each name=value string to classad::ClassAd::Insert(const std::string&), which doesn't know about old ClassAd escaping rules.

This can be fixed fairly easily in 8.7 by using ClassAdParser set to old ClassAd mode. In 8.6, we'll need something equivalent to ConvertEscapingOldToNew() from the Condor util lib.

This was first reported at https://ticket.opensciencegrid.org/34573
remarks:
2017-Sep-07 10:36:45 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

Nice patch, just some minor comments:

  1. Private helper functions introduced, like ConvertEscapingOldToNew(), should be declared as static. Fixed this in commit [52283].
  2. Comment explaining why ConvertEscapingOldToNew() was copied out of the util lib and into the classad python binding would have been nice (ie because the python classad library purposefully avoids linking with libcondorutils), although I guess this is not such a big deal since this code clone is soon to be ripped out in the master branch.
  3. Please create a ticket for re-implementing this patch in the master branch, and make it a child ticket of this one.

Resolving.
